Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
the "start staking" button is the same as issuing the `setgenerate true 0` command and nothing more
splitting across all segments, or even specific ones, is much more efficient than that button
more work from you gives you more rewards

Author: Bernz - Selling LABS#9130
Content: So that would explain the rich list containing like 5 bulk addys and the other 95 being different groups of the same number, someone splitting their stack to maximize their chance of hitting a block reward

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: yes

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: each new block a random segid is picked and addresses in that segment get "first crack at it", then each other segment gets a time delayed "chance" (in simple terms)

Author: Bernz - Selling LABS#9130
Content: I knew enough to split my verus stack into like 10 addys but it seems some people go upwards of like 50, true potential of staking

Author: Bernz - Selling LABS#9130
Content: I'd pay a small bounty for someone to put together a doc detailing how to start staking labs

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: 64 addys (one in each segment) is generally best

Author: Alright#0419
Content: verus staking uses an entirely separate algo, splitting on VRSC likely helps to some extent, but the strategy of it compared to pos64(LABS's staking algo) differs drastically

Author: Alright#0419
Content: pos64 very much rewards the people willing to put in the time to think about the strategy of it, verus staking much less so

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: true, I was over-generalizing for the sake of trying to keep it less technical 😛
